title: Tyson Fury's trainer laughs off claims Gypsy King takes 'padding out of his sparring gloves'
text:
Tyson Fury's trainer Ben Davison has dismissed accusations the heavyweight boxer tampers with his gloves to hurt sparring partners.

American heavyweight Nicholas Asberry, a sparring partner of Fury's, accused the self-styled Gypsy King of taking the padding out of his gloves.

'Took the padding out of his gloves and still hits like new born baby,' Asberry wrote in a video post on Instagram.

Ben Davison (R) has denied accusations that Tyson Fury takes padding out of sparring gloves

'Top Rank signed a f****** cheater who still couldn't hang. Tyson release the sparring and show them what really went down!'

But in an angry response, Davison insisted that the accusations were ludicrous.

He wrote on Twitter: 'What do you think mate? Tyson/ or a team taking padding out his gloves to hurt sparring partners?!?

'When they only do 1-2 maybe 3 rounds at a time in and out? For THERE (sic) benefit! Funny how Tyson has great relationship with everybody he spars. Convenient timing too!'

Fury is out of the gym currently, as he prepares to face WWE star Braun Strowman at the Crown Jewel pay-per-view event on October 31 in Saudi Arabia.
description: Nicholas Asberry, a sparring partner of Fury's, accused the self-styled Gypsy King of taking the padding out of his gloves. Davison insisted that the accusations were ludicrous.
